findings.description: When splitting a veNFT, the proportional amount calculation `originalLocked.amount * amounts[i] / totalWeight` loses precision due to integer division. The sum of split amounts may be less than the original amount, causing tokens to be permanently locked in the contract with no recovery mechanism.
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID: 1) It describes a concrete exploit where tokens can be permanently locked due to precision loss. 2) It does not require any trusted role compromise. 3) There is no existing mitigation for this precision loss. 4) The issue is clearly within the scope of the analyzed contract. 5) It is not a design choice but an unintentional flaw. 6) It has a material impact as it can lead to loss of user funds.

findings.description: The DOMAIN_TYPEHASH includes version string but excludes chainId from typehash definition. More critically, signature doesn't bind to specific contract address properly in struct, allowing potential cross-contract replay if same signer exists on different deployments.
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID: 1) It describes a concrete exploit where signatures can be replayed across different chains. 2) It does not require any trusted role compromise. 3) There is no existing mitigation for this cross-chain replay issue. 4) The issue is clearly within the scope of the analyzed contract. 5) It is not a design choice but an unintentional flaw. 6) It has a material impact as it can lead to unauthorized delegation of votes.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability related to `_checkpoint` creating a new epoch with the same timestamp for `increase_amount` was not mentioned in the findings.

notes: The analysis identified two valid security concerns but did not identify the target vulnerability related to the `_checkpoint` function.
